Package ca.on.oicr.gsi.shesmu.compiler.definitions

Class ActionDefinition

java.lang.Object
ca.on.oicr.gsi.shesmu.compiler.definitions.ActionDefinition
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseSimulateRequest.FakeActionDefinition
public abstract class ActionDefinition extends Object
Describes an action that can be invoked by the Shesmu language.

  • Constructor Details

    • ActionDefinition

      public ActionDefinition(String name, String description, Path filename, Stream<ActionParameterDefinition> parameters)
      Constructs a new action definition
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the action which must be a valid Shesmu identifier
      description - a human-readable description of the action
      filename - the file where the action is defined, or null if not appropriate
      parameters - the parameters that can be set on this action

  • Method Details

    • description

      public final String description()
      A human-readable explanation of what this action does and where it came from.
      Returns:
      the description

    • filename

      public Path filename()
      The configuration file associated with this parameter, if one exists.
      Returns:
      the filepath

    • initialize

      public abstract void initialize(org.objectweb.asm.commons.GeneratorAdapter methodGen)
      Write the bytecode to create a new instance of the action.

      This method should create an new instance of the action and leave it on the stack. If there is any hidden state (remote server addresses, workflow identifier), they must be handled at this stage.

      Parameters:
      methodGen - the method to generate the bytecode in

    • name

      public final String name()
      The name of the action as it will appear in the Shesmu language

      It must be a valid Shesmu identifier.

      Returns:
      the name

    • parameters

      public final Stream<ActionParameterDefinition> parameters()
      List all the parameters that can be set for this action to be performed.
      Returns:
      the parameters for the action

    • supplementaryInformation

      public SupplementaryInformation supplementaryInformation()
      Additional information that can be displayed in the user interface with formatting
      Returns:
      a generator for the additional information
